data.title: Faster lines than you think
data.text: UT Arlington does a pretty good job of keeping books in stock. They also Apple area where they sell Apple products which are quite popular. You can also get a discounted version of Microsoft word, which is wonderful! I can't remember the price, but it is definitely worth it if you don't already have it. The lines get really long around the time each term starts, but they are pretty good at moving people through. You can also do online orders and pick those up on the second level. They are actually now doing construction to the building. I believe it is to expand it out. Since a lot of the employees are students sometimes you have the issue of them talking to each other and taking their time to assist you. One major plus is all the school swag you can get. The clothes in there are really nice as well as the other school spirit items. The pricing for books for the most part are not as high as other places at least for the ones I needed.

data.title: Great bookstore
data.text:
This is a great bookstore if you are looking for specific texts and supplies like scientific calculators, etc.
It was also a little nostalgic to go back to s college bookstore, as it had been several years.

data.title: Have a Wide Assortment
data.text: The bookstore is two stories and it pretty decent in size. Their books are way overpriced (to be fair that is applicable to any college bookstore) so we rent them on Amazon but they have a great selection of clothing and other unique UTA items.

data.title: Top off your visit to the UTA campus here
data.text:
For UTA alums, the UTA bookstore has terrific alum tshirts.  For current UTA students and everyone else, the UTA bookstore has excellent selections of UTA - and other - merchandise.  

The bookstore personnel are friendly and suggested sending a text to the MAVRICK (yes, the e is, in fact, ommitted in the text-message promotion) line for a 20 percent discount, which we did.  

Also, on a practical note, the UTA bookstore stocks bottled water, so it is a good water stop after a visit to the UTA campus on a hot July day.
